intro: Nematanthus mirabilis, commonly known as the flame flower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular, brightly colored flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte or lithophyte, often found on trees or rocks in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a glossy texture, while its flowers are known for their vibrant hues of red, orange, and yellow. Nematanthus mirabilis is cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable growing conditions.
